At https://github.com/ros-visualization/rviz/issues ? Bacause if they change their dependency to libogre-1.9-dev, it will break the combination of gazebo5+rviz for example. So should i ticket rosdistro at https://github.com/ros/rosdistro/issues instead? They would have to upgrade all the builds...

issue.title: Gazebo 6 conflicts with rviz because of ogre 1.8/1.9 dependency on Ubuntu

content.raw:
It's possible to have a debian depend on a package using an `or` relationship. So, rviz should depend on `libogre-1.8 | libogre-1.9`. Gazebo6 on trusty should have the same dependency.

I should say that I think this is possible based on reading [the debian documentation](https://www.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/ch-relationships.html), but I haven't actually tried it yet.
content.html:
It's possible to have a debian depend on a package using an or relationship. So, rviz should depend on libogre-1.8 | libogre-1.9. Gazebo6 on trusty should have the same dependency.

I should say that I think this is possible based on reading the debian documentation, but I haven't actually tried it yet.

issue.title: Gazebo 6 conflicts with rviz because of ogre 1.8/1.9 dependency on Ubuntu

content.raw: I have a workaround for others, which solves the problem until the dependencies will be fixed: I created custom ros-indigo-rviz.deb package without the dependency to libogre-1.8-dev. The Nathan's solution ```libogre-1.8 | libogre-1.9``` works as well. You can modify deb packages according to this guide: http://superuser.com/questions/280370/how-to-easily-edit-control-file-in-deb-package.
content.html: I have a workaround for others, which solves the problem until the dependencies will be fixed: I created custom ros-indigo-rviz.deb package without the dependency to libogre-1.8-dev. The Nathan's solution libogre-1.8 | libogre-1.9 works as well. You can modify deb packages according to this guide: http://superuser.com/questions/280370/how-to-easily-edit-control-file-in-deb-package.

issue.title: Gazebo 6 conflicts with rviz because of ogre 1.8/1.9 dependency on Ubuntu
Gazebo 6 conflicts with rviz because of ogre 1.8/1.9 dependency on Ubuntu

content.raw:
Rviz devs replied that there was an agreement between ros and gazebo that indigo will use libogre-1.8 and jade libogre-1.9: https://github.com/ros-infrastructure/rep/pull/89#issuecomment-69232117.
So i guess updating gazebo6-dev dependency to ```libogre-1.8 | libogre-1.9``` will fix that.
content.html: Rviz devs replied that there was an agreement between ros and gazebo that indigo will use libogre-1.8 and jade libogre-1.9: https://github.com/ros-infrastructure/rep/pull/89#issuecomment-69232117. So i guess updating gazebo6-dev dependency to libogre-1.8 | libogre-1.9 will fix that.

issue.title: Gazebo 6 conflicts with rviz because of ogre 1.8/1.9 dependency on Ubuntu

content.raw: I thought that we would use libogre-1.9 for jade, except on trusty, which would continue to use libogre-1.8. @\_jrivero_
content.html: I thought that we would use libogre-1.9 for jade, except on trusty, which would continue to use libogre-1.8. @_jrivero_

issue.title: Gazebo 6 conflicts with rviz because of ogre 1.8/1.9 dependency on Ubuntu

content.raw:
There was a bug in our buildingfarm and the gazebo package 6.1.0-2 (revision 2 is the one that includes the fix) was not uploaded to the repo, it should be fixed in during the next couple of hours.

As a workaround, you should be able to [download the packages](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo6-debbuilder/76/artifact/pkgs/) from our jenkins.
content.html:
There was a bug in our buildingfarm and the gazebo package 6.1.0-2 (revision 2 is the one that includes the fix) was not uploaded to the repo, it should be fixed in during the next couple of hours.

As a workaround, you should be able to download the packages from our jenkins.

issue.title: Gazebo 6 conflicts with rviz because of ogre 1.8/1.9 dependency on Ubuntu

content.raw:
It was my understanding that gazebo5 would use libogre1.8, leaving gazeob6 to use ogre1.9. I know we talked about releasing gazebo6 on trusty with libogre-18 a couple days ago. Here are my musing since then: 

I'm going to be pedantic, so bear with me. ROS behaves kind-of-like a package manager. For each version of ROS, specific versions of other libraries are selected. This is similar to, but no identical to, an operating system like ubuntu. According to Ubuntu, once it is released a new major version of a package can not be included. For example, if gazebo6 is released into ubuntu 15.10, then we can't put gazebo7 into ubuntu 15.10 (some caveats apply). Bringing this back to ROS; jade selected gazebo5 and therefore we shouldn't expect to use gazebo6 with jade. However, a person is free to compile from source.

Now less pedantic. We have gone down the road of releasing gazebo6 debians for jade, so we should make it work. It sounds like the only way to accomplish this is to re-release gazebo6 in trusty with a different dependency (libogre-1.8). This is something that should not be done since it could make another end user very unhappy (for example, an end user that installs gazebo6 on trusty and writes a plugin that needs libogre-1.9). This last sentence was mostly a note to myself to carefully check dependencies before releasing.
content.html:
It was my understanding that gazebo5 would use libogre1.8, leaving gazeob6 to use ogre1.9. I know we talked about releasing gazebo6 on trusty with libogre-18 a couple days ago. Here are my musing since then:

I'm going to be pedantic, so bear with me. ROS behaves kind-of-like a package manager. For each version of ROS, specific versions of other libraries are selected. This is similar to, but no identical to, an operating system like ubuntu. According to Ubuntu, once it is released a new major version of a package can not be included. For example, if gazebo6 is released into ubuntu 15.10, then we can't put gazebo7 into ubuntu 15.10 (some caveats apply). Bringing this back to ROS; jade selected gazebo5 and therefore we shouldn't expect to use gazebo6 with jade. However, a person is free to compile from source.

Now less pedantic. We have gone down the road of releasing gazebo6 debians for jade, so we should make it work. It sounds like the only way to accomplish this is to re-release gazebo6 in trusty with a different dependency (libogre-1.8). This is something that should not be done since it could make another end user very unhappy (for example, an end user that installs gazebo6 on trusty and writes a plugin that needs libogre-1.9). This last sentence was mostly a note to myself to carefully check dependencies before releasing.

issue.title: Gazebo 6 conflicts with rviz because of ogre 1.8/1.9 dependency on Ubuntu

content.raw:
My thoughts:

> Bringing this back to ROS; jade selected gazebo5 and therefore we shouldn't expect to use gazebo6 with jade. However, a person is free to compile from source.

I agree. The agreement between the Gazebo team and the ROS team affects only to ros_gazebo_pkgs of the gazebo version selected by ROS distribution (gazebo5 in this case). Nothing to do with gazebo6.

>  We have gone down the road of releasing gazebo6 debians for jade, so we should make it work.

They really can work no matter the ogre version in gazebo, the problem is to install RVIZ with ros_gazebo6_pkgs.

> This is something that should not be done since it could make another end user very unhappy (for example, an end user that installs gazebo6 on trusty and writes a plugin that needs libogre-1.9)

That is completely a valid reasoning. And probably the right to do after releasing the first gazebo6 using ogre-1.9. The change was motivated by the assumption of there are a good bunch of users that would benefit of it (ROS/Jade and ROS/Indigo + Gazebo6) vs a probably a little part of them (Gazebo + ogre-1.9 which use 1.9 features) that will suffer the consequences. Bug again, does not fully justify the change once released.
content.html:
My thoughts:

Bringing this back to ROS; jade selected gazebo5 and therefore we shouldn't expect to use gazebo6 with jade. However, a person is free to compile from source.

I agree. The agreement between the Gazebo team and the ROS team affects only to ros_gazebo_pkgs of the gazebo version selected by ROS distribution (gazebo5 in this case). Nothing to do with gazebo6.

We have gone down the road of releasing gazebo6 debians for jade, so we should make it work.

They really can work no matter the ogre version in gazebo, the problem is to install RVIZ with ros_gazebo6_pkgs.

This is something that should not be done since it could make another end user very unhappy (for example, an end user that installs gazebo6 on trusty and writes a plugin that needs libogre-1.9)

That is completely a valid reasoning. And probably the right to do after releasing the first gazebo6 using ogre-1.9. The change was motivated by the assumption of there are a good bunch of users that would benefit of it (ROS/Jade and ROS/Indigo + Gazebo6) vs a probably a little part of them (Gazebo + ogre-1.9 which use 1.9 features) that will suffer the consequences. Bug again, does not fully justify the change once released.

issue.title: Gazebo 6 conflicts with rviz because of ogre 1.8/1.9 dependency on Ubuntu

content.raw:
We agree on keeping the change of libogre-1.8-dev for gazebo6 but remember not to change dependencies once a major version is released.

`gazebo6 6.1.0-2` is already in the repo depending on ogre-1.8, so it should be able to be installed with RVIZ.
content.html:
We agree on keeping the change of libogre-1.8-dev for gazebo6 but remember not to change dependencies once a major version is released.

gazebo6 6.1.0-2 is already in the repo depending on ogre-1.8, so it should be able to be installed with RVIZ.
